citation.article-title: Streptomyces thermocarboxydovorans sp. nov. and Streptomyces thermocarboxydus sp. nov., two moderately thermophilic carboxydotrophic species from soil

p.s: Description of Streptomyces thermocarboxydovorans sp. nov.

Streptomyces thermocarboxydovorans (ther.mo.car.box.y.do'vor.ans. Gr. n. therme heat; L. n. carbo charcoal, carbon; Gr. adj. oxys sharp, acid; L. v. voro to consume; M .L. part. adj. thermocarboxydovorans thermophilic, carbon monoxide consuming)
The description is based on data taken from this and earlier studies (7, 32).

Aerobic, Gram-positive, moderately thermophilic, facultatively chemolithotrophic actinomycete with extensively branched substrate and aerial mycelia. Rectiflexibiles chains of smooth-surfaced spores are borne on aerial hyphae.
The aerial spore mass is grey; distinctive substrate mycelium colours are not produced.
Melanin pigments are not produced on peptone-iron agar.
The organism oxidizes hydrogen and can use carbon monoxide as a sole source of carbon for energy and growth.
Positive activity is seen for chemotrypsin, cystine arylamidase, α-galactosidase and lipase but not for α-glucosidase (API-ZYM).
Similarly, N-acetyl-β-D-ghcosamidase is produced but not β-D-cellobiosidase or β-D-xylosidase.
Arbutin, DNA, elastin, guanine, hypoxanthine, RNA, starch, L-tyrosine and xanthine are degraded.
Nitrate is reduced and hydrogen sulphide produced.
Neither allantoin nor urea are hydrolysed.

D-Fructose, D-lactose, sodium fumarate, sodium pyruvate, but not adonitol or xylitol, are used as sole carbon sources and L-arginine, D-aminobutyric acid, L-cysteine, L-histidine, L-methionine, potassium nitrate, L-serine, Lthreonine, L-valine, but not L-hydroxyproline, as sole nitrogen sources.

Growth occurs between 20°C and 55°C and in the presence of adenine (0.5%, w/v), crystal violet (0.001%, w/v), phenyl ethanol (0.3%, v/v), potassium tellurite (0.001%, w/v), sodium azide (0.01%, w/v), chloramphenicol (2 μg ml-1), chlortetracycline (4 μg ml-1), gentamicin sulphate (1 μg ml-1), novobiocin (03 μg fml-1), oleandomycin phosphate (1 μg ml-1), penicillin G (16 μg ml-1), polymixin B (32 μg ml-1) and tobramycin sulphate (1 μg ml-1).
In contrast, growth was inhibited in the presence of phenol (1%, w/v), sodium azide (0.02%, w/v), rifampicin (0.5 μg ml-1) and streptomycin sulphate (2 μg ml-1).
The DNA base composition is 74.7±0.05 mol YO G + C.
